criteria: Application of Science and Engineering Ideas
descriptions: No understanding of forces and motion is demonstrated.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of forces and motion; struggles to define force or motion.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of forces and motion; can define force and motion but struggles to connect them.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of forces and motion; can explain force and motion and provide simple examples.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of forces and motion; can explain and apply the concepts of force and motion with detailed examples.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of forces and motion; can explain, apply, and analyze complex scenarios involving forces and motion with sophisticated examples.
Unable to apply science and engineering ideas to design a device.
Struggles to apply science and engineering ideas; the designed device is not related to minimizing force during a collision.
Applies science and engineering ideas with limited success; the designed device has minimal impact on minimizing force during a collision.
Applies science and engineering ideas adequately; the designed device shows some promise in minimizing force during a collision.
Applies science and engineering ideas effectively; the designed device significantly minimizes force during a collision.
Applies science and engineering ideas exceptionally well; the designed device optimally minimizes force during a collision through innovative design.
No attempt to evaluate or refine the device.
Attempts to evaluate or refine the device but lacks a clear methodology or criteria.
Evaluates and refines the device with limited success; improvements are minimal.
Evaluates and refines the device adequately; identifies and addresses some weaknesses in the design.
Evaluates and refines the device effectively; identifies and addresses most weaknesses, leading to significant improvements.
Evaluates and refines the device comprehensively; demonstrates a deep understanding of the device's performance and implements optimal improvements based on thorough analysis.
Fails to consider constraints or criteria in the design process.
Considers constraints or criteria superficially; the design does not effectively address these considerations.
Considers constraints and criteria with limited success; the design partially addresses these considerations.
Considers constraints and criteria adequately; the design addresses most of these considerations.
Considers constraints and criteria effectively; the design demonstrates a strong understanding of the requirements and limitations.
Considers constraints and criteria comprehensively; the design demonstrates an exceptional understanding of requirements, limitations, and trade-offs, leading to an optimized solution.
